<div class="text">
  <p>   

Eutheria Laboratory is an evolutionary genomics lab run by Dr. Bill Murphy at Texas A&M University that utilizes comparative genomics to study the processes of adaptation, speciation, and diversification in mammals.
  </p>
  
  <p> Over the year I spent at Dr. Murphy's lab under the instruction of Nicole Foley, I learned skills such as pseudohaploid genome assembly, basic bioinformatics analysis, and scientific communication and outreach. The projects I was a part of focused on wide-scale mammal genome analysis from an evolutionary standpoint.
  

</div>
